bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 15 (Thursday, January 24, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. KING of Iowa:H.R. 773.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I Section 8 Clause 4[Page H1213]

item.name: Immigration Integrity, Security, and Enforcement Subcommittee

item.title: Legal Immigration for the U.S. Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committees on Ways and Means, Foreign Affairs, and Education and Labor, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.name: Immigration Integrity, Security, and Enforcement Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text:
This bill eliminates EB-5 visas and the EB-5 regional center pilot program.

The EB-5 visa provides lawful permanent residence to foreign nationals who invest (directly or through a regional center) a specified amount of capital in a new commercial enterprise in the United States and create at least 10 jobs.

bill.title: To terminate the EB-5 program.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Citizenship.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
